meanings.definition: To punish by dragging under the keel of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The pirates threatened to keelhaul the disobedient crew member.
meanings.sent2: The captain decided to keelhaul the sailor for his betrayal.
meanings.sent3: The idea of being keelhauled for breaking the rules made the sailors behave.
meanings.sent4: The consequences of his actions felt like a looming keelhaul.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of a keelhaul served as a warning to all aboard the ship.
